content.description: Very thin climbing up an increasingly difficult blunt buttress.
content.protection: 7 bolts to Infectious Groove's 3 bolt anchor
content.location: The bolted line right of the Coup de Etat/Infectious Groove start.

content.description: This is primarily a well-bolted sport climb, but a few pieces of gear are nice to have at the start.  Begin at the large and somewhat dirty left-facing corner to the right of Stanley Face.  Climb this easily (placing a cam or two as needed -- I used a .3 and .75) to a high bolt.  Above the first bolt, traverse slightly left and climb the cool ~11c seam feature with gastons, sidepulls, and technical feet.  At the top of the seam, traverse left again and climb the easy top portion of Infectious Groove to the shared anchors.
content.protection: A piece or two of gear, then five bolts to a chain anchor shared with Stanley Face and Infectious Groove.
content.location: This is the route to the immediate right of the Stanley Face.  It starts up the large, somewhat dirty left-facing corner.  See picture.

content.description: This sustained route clips three bolts at the beginning and continues up the only crack on the wall past a pumpy finger crack.
Climb upwards clipping three bolts before moving over the obvious crack splitting the wall.  Continue to the left past at angling flake system.
content.protection: draws.  10?  you can see all the bolts.

content.description:
Start just left of Coup De Etat.

Thin crack for 12' to 2 bolts and a technical high step and big reach to a crack.

Climb up right, then back left.

Reach up, clip a bolt, side pulls and a big reach get you through the crux. Joins Coup de Etat before it's crux.

Continue up Coup.
content.location: The line 10' left of Coup de Etat
